Location: Between villages of Abkuk (ancient Basilicus) and Asin (ancient Iasos),
Material: Red-pink and white marble (cipollino rosso), used locally and exported regionally and inter-regionally
Bibliography: Mielsch 1985: 46; Gnoli 1988: 243- 245; Monna and Pensabene 1977: 109-113; Andreoli et al. 2002

Location: On the coast just north of the western end of Lake Mareotis, west of Alexandria

Material: Gypsum, limestone and sandstone, used locally in the Roman period
Green-grey and white streaked marble (cipollino); used locally from the Classical period but only exported widely in the Roman Imperial
Bibliography: Mielsch 1985: 58; Gnoli 1988: 181- 183; Lambraki 1980: 31-62; Hankey 1965; Pensabene 1998b; Sutherland and Sutherland 2002; Tsoflias 1982; Chidiroglou 2009

Material: White marble (Paros-3), used locally and exported regionally and inter- regionally
